intro: Cattleya × mesquitae var. alba, commonly known as the White Cattleya, is a hybrid orchid species native to Central America. It is characterized by its large, fragrant, white flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, tropical environments. Its leaves are broad and革质, providing structural support and efficient water retention. This variety is prized for its beauty and is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens and greenhouses.
